bug.author: treuille
bug.summary: Docstrings should not dipslay as magic strings in Python 3.8
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
In Python 3.8, function docstrings are being displayed a magic strings. This is incorret. The correct behavior is exhibited in Python 3.6 which supresses displaying function docstrings using magic. <denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run the following in Python 3.8: import streamlit as st
def f(): """This is a docstring.""" pass
f() <denchmark-h:h1>Behavior</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior</denchmark-h>
You will see "This is a docstring." displayed in the app. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1673013/71793813-835ef280-300c-11ea-87fd-501832b57f20.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
We should see no ouput, because the first string is a docstring. Note: Streamlit performs the correct behavior in Python 3.6. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>$ streamlit version && python --version && pyenv --version && sw_vers && "/Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome" --version
Streamlit, version 0.52.2 Python 3.8.0 pyenv 1.2.15 ProductName: Mac OS X ProductVersion: 10.15.2 BuildVersion: 19C57 Google Chrome 79.0.3945.88 </denchmark-code>
